Package org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.model

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Arc
    The arc represents a single length of railroad track, whose properties such as maximum speed are uniform all over it.
    Itinerary
    Represents the way a Train travels the Route, including all the stops for MaintenanceWindows and WaitTimes.
    ItineraryAssignment
    Contains an Itinerary for a particular Train on a particular Route.
    MaintenanceWindow
    A maintenance window is a period of time when no Train is allowed to enter the part of the Route delimited by the east and the west Node.
    Node
    A node is a place on the Route where two Arcs join or where the Route ends.
    Route
    Represents a way in which it is possible to travel the Territory.
    Route.Builder
    Used to build the Route by specifying a series of Arcs.
    Section
    A section is part of Route that is delimited by two Nodes.
    ScheduleAdherenceRequirement
    Schedule adherence requirement specifies that a Train is expected to arrive at a given Node at a given time.
    Train
    Train is defined by the RAS problem description, including its attributes.
    WaitTime
    At specific parts of the route, called "wait points", the train can be stopped.
    WaitTimeAssignment
    Represents a relationship between a wait point and a wait time.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Track
    A track is a type of railroad that the arc consists of.
    Train.Type
    Represents the schedule adherence train type defined by the RAS problem description.
